Review.Titre: It is impossible to use
Review.Contenu: It is impossible to use. No understanding how to create new time lines etc. Dates are not working. If I add today  until next month, the whole ppt is a mess and it continuously changes my date to 2021 or so.... I have watch few films but mine is a catastrophe...

Review.Titre: bought the pilot version a year ago
Review.Contenu: bought the pilot version a year ago, never used it, now have been billed almost $500, trying to get a refund but no one responds... very dissapointing

Review.Titre: "Free" is a Lie and Waste of Time
Review.Contenu: Why have a free version?  If one wanted to determine whether this is the program they wanted they would want to test the actual capabilities of the program.  If the free version doesn't allow one to alter a timeline in any way they wouldn't already be able to do so in Powerpoint or Excel, then how is one able to accurately assess whether they should be 100 bucks to use the service.  In short, I'm sure its a fine service... but if they want to offer a free test version, perhaps it should have ANY features that can tell one if it is useful.  If they do not want to offer a free test version, fine.  They can rely on their brand name.  But, they should not do an in-between version where they pretend to offer a free test that does not at all test the service (because you cannot do anything at all to edit a timeline--the whole point of the service).In any event, I'm sure they have plenty of corporate accounts and need not concern themselves with small-timers who would like to assure the product works for them before blowing a hundred dollars per subscription.In sum, waste of time if you are not absolutely sure before testing the product that this is absolutely what you need (I am positive they allow their corporate clients to test it before committing).

Review.Titre: Support is non-existent
Review.Contenu: Support is non-existent. I've been emailing the 'feedback (at) officetimeline (dot) com' multiple times since November and never received one reply. The product doesn't support Mac which isn't clear on the website so I'm looking for the 'offered' refund according to the site. The support phone number is not toll free so they don't really care about international customers apparently. I'm at a complete loss as to how to engage with this company.

Review.Titre: I have subscribed for a few years at…

In May 2021 after trying to increase the price to $99 and then $149 for the Pro plus, I have decided that this "add on" is way too expensive. $150 a year for some routines used once or twice a year.  That’s more than I pay for a full windows package. $100 extra for some fancy swim lanes for Pro+ based on my current legacy rate of $59. You must be joking.Bye,  I will not be renewing,  will just go back to doing it in Excel and Powerpoint

Review.Titre: Just an OK Product - I Wouldn't Spend $100 on the Pro Version
Review.Contenu: It makes decent looking Gantt charts, but once you create one, you can't go back and edit it.  Its locked as a picture forever.  You're required go build a completely new one from scratch every time you need to reflect an update or change of any kind.  It's honestly easier just to go find someone who created a Gantt chart template in Excel, use that, and paste it into PowerPoint.  You'll save yourself $100 and a lot of frustration.

Review.Contenu: It sucks. I've yet to use it and I'm three days in. The templates did not load. I purchased the pro version. It's blank. Click on new nothing loads, the pop up is blank. The import from Smartsheet is messy. The Style pane panel doesn't load, and not compatibility mode doesn't help.  Running dual monitors shouldn't matter but even with one - doesn't work.  I'm running update to date office 365 extremely disappointed. Contact support 3 times to no avail. Time for a refund.

If you use VMWare on that side for PC, you're out of luck.I have abandoned it.  Disappointed.

I did not ask for this, as I stated, the software is functional and I purchased it to have said functionality. If they were willing to offer a refund to an unhappy customer, fine, offer me that option, but don't unilaterally make a decision without talking to me, the customer. My opinion of the customer service team and or customer policy's are a negative 5 stars, but that is not an option in this rating system.Original Review: While functional, I was surprised by how limited the options were once downloading the full version of Office Timeline. Not sure I think it's worth the money. The software also seems to try to outsmart the user and change things in one area when you only want them changed in another area. I know what I'm doing, I don't need the software to try to 'correct' me. Bottom line, gets the job done, but if you plan to use this for a variety of things, you will probably find the lack of templates and options very limiting.

Review.Titre: Office Timeline is okay, but...
Review.Contenu: Office Timeline is generally a good and useful software. Nevertheless, I don't recommend it. What I don't like at all is its pricing model. In my opinion it's brazen. I can't understand, why such a relatively small Office-add-on, which is only used from time to time, shall cost nearly as much as the main program – and, on top of it, it's only offered as a subscription model. (The offered Freemium model is bit of a joke. It's limited to just ten items, which is far too little to make something useful).The pricey subscription model is a deal breaker for me. I don't see how the (time-)cost that one may save with this software, which is only used from time to time, could justify the high expenses. In terms of usability, I also see potential for improvement. It would be nice to consider general settings - also for date formats. Having to change the date format again and again is not fun. Same thing for removing the dates. It has to be done separately through a rather cumbersome menu structure, which takes too much time due to the many clicks.Also, creating bigger, more complex timelines (to be copied into Word reports) in Power-Point with the Office Timeline Add-on, can be quite a mission. Especially, if the Power Point slide is smaller than the timeline. As a consequence, Power Point sometimes switches unintentionally and annoyingly to the next slide. The only way out is to reduce the picture size in order to see the whole (Power Point-)picture. But then everything is so small that it is difficult to recognize something, let alone work efficiently.

Review.Titre: Big disappointment infunctionality and cprice
Review.Contenu: 1.	Editing is not simple. The changes you make revert back if you make one more change. If you make a manual change, that's even worse because if you then, for example, edit the timelime after making a manual change, the whole thing reverts back to the template's default making you lose all edits made. 2.	It's not easy to move task bars up and down and keep them that way. It would be nice if at least it could behave similarly to the SmartArts feature, where you can at least convert it to text or shapes and go on to make manual changes. 3.	The other thing that doesn't work well if you import a list of tasks and dates. It doesn't do anything close to what it should be and it always turns out it's more efficient to enter dates manually and individually. Which ends up taking too much time. 4.	Also, if I delete a timeline bar, for example, once I make any other update, the timeline comes back. In essence, the button called "Accept Changes" simply doesn't work... Ever. If I like a specific template, there's no way I can move a timeline from the bottom to the top. 5.	If I change the colors of the task bars, again, once I edit tasks, the original colors come back…6.	Under the "New" button, I don't see the point of having the 2 options ("new timeline" and "templates") if both behave the same. The same goes for the "import" option that appears twice but do the same thing. The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1 is because I actually do use some of it. I like the concept for Office Timeline Pro, but it just didn't deliver for me. It's definitely NOT worth the cost because it has way too much improvement to be made overall. The items listed above have a big negative impact on the experience of the tool for the users. When I purchased it, I was under the impression it was far more efficient, but there were times when I was in a hurry that it was much faster to create something complete manually using shapes and texts instead of using this expensive tool. Will definitely not purchase again nor would recommend.

That is especially helpful for roles that have to keep it high level with higher management functions. Probably less for true project managers that need to use this to mange project on a daily baisis. Myself need to get over the first stage of intial timelines in a project charter and finding a way to sue it as a tool to report progress/monitoring progress.  That seems to be a hurdle for now.   The way new changes reset earlier changes made is a bit of nuisance. Disappointed that some features such as sub-swimlanes are still subject to an additional upgrade.

Review.Titre: Timeline template edits need help.
Review.Contenu: Timeline is an effective product; however, improvements are needed to template usage.1. When words do not fit inside blocks when using center justification, the words get moved to the side and are still the color of the text if it is inside the block. Suggestion is to either default the text color to auto or to auto increase the depth of the box to fit the text.2. When using a template and editing the layout to accommodate the slide space, if you edit the data, the slide will revert to its original look and feel. Suggestion is to maintain the edited look and feel.3. When using template and import, if the page doesn't fit on the slide, you must edit to accommodate slide space and brings us back to problem 2 above. Suggestion is to have an AUTO SUGGEST to fit slide

Review.Titre: Good tool, can get better
Review.Contenu: I think the tool is great. It has helped me communicate timelines more effectively.Different security tools treat this tool differently, some will cause it to get blocked and Powerpoint to frequently crash. There may be something the tool can improve to make security tools trust it. I wish there were floating licenses for larger teams or organizations so the licenses are purchased and managed based on need and utilization. Node-locked licenses are not efficient and companies will block such licenses during cost-cutting times.

Review.Titre: Good but not great!
Review.Contenu: This software is one of two other software that can create well designed PowerPoint slides, but the only one that works with PowerPoint on your machine and not online. However it is very basic currently and can not do the following:1.	The ability Show dependencies between tasks/milestones.2.	The ability to zoom in on a schedule so that you can focus on a particular window of time instead of having to show your whole 2 yr. Schedule 3.	The ability to multi select tasks/milestones in the “Edit Data” window so that a user can move multiple tasks in/out of swim lanes/Sub-swim lanes.4.    The ability to show slippage based on your baselineall very important if you truly want to present a informative schedule.

Review.Titre: I do like the automated features based…
Review.Contenu: I do like the automated features based on the data. However, it doesn't do a good job of making it fit on a slide with a lot of information. I can see how some lanes can join on the same line (non-Gant chart like) but it doesn't do that and it causes to have so many lines and in the end, the information doesn't fit in a slide

Review.Titre: I purchased the Pro version and I am disappointed that It doesn't offer online access
Review.Contenu: I purchased the Pro version and I would expect to have also access to the online version. Usually we get the entire suite of experience when we purchase the most expensive product. Next year I won't renew the pro version.

Review.Titre: Mac not supported
Review.Contenu: The tool is great for embedding timelines with dependencies directly into my presentation decks. The issue is I use a Mac and the tool is not supported! I have to use a VDI to remote into a Windows machine to update my timeline. Please add Mac support.

Review.Titre: Idea excellent..... product limited
Review.Contenu: The concept and intent is excellent, as it bridges the gap between MPP/Excel/Other with the kind of visuals that Execs still seem to like.Basic functionality is good, but it's missing a whole bunch of things which are currently a cause of frustration. I have loads, but a few which frustrate me most are:- Formatting bigger plans across multiple PPT pages doesn't exist. A lot of manual fidgeting to do this.- V limited 'column' options to include in timeline view- Limited compatibility with macOS is a crime.... SaaS functionality should be the same as native app.I really want to like this more, but currently I can only use it to capture a limited amount of info at a very high level (I've used both browser-based and native versions, and they both leave a lot to be desired).As a consultant I produce slide ware like it's going out of fashion..... Make the product richer and more-user friendly and you'll have a friend for life.Sorry. But you did ask for feedback....

Review.Titre: My biggest issue is that timeline…
Review.Contenu: My biggest issue is that timeline graphics formatting gets messed up every time a date changes, causing all graphics to have to be repositioned each time there is a change to a data field.

Review.Titre: useful with some bugs
Review.Contenu: this tool is very needed, and useful, however some issues managing several timeline in the same slide deck, with information copied over from one to the next.needs improvement!

Review.Titre: Custom Timeline Position Getting Reset
Review.Contenu: In general, it's ok. Key issue I'm facing right now is that the custom Timeline Position I'm setting keeps getting reset. Can you fix that?

Review.Titre: My biggest challenge is not being able…
Review.Contenu: My biggest challenge is not being able to add responsible to each task (at least not on the timeline formats I use). I miss having a cleaner timeline, all of them look very busy. And I can't pinpoint it exactly, but the system could be more user-friendly. I am willing to have someone from your team watch as I build a timeline if you feel that would help make it more friendly.

Review.Titre: Start Up
Review.Contenu: The concept to create charts for MS Project is very usfull.  The use Power Point is a bit combersome.  Would be easier to have a stand alone app that reads the MSP data.Your real time support is lacking.  I struggled with creating reports for my NASA Program.   Called several times for support to no avail.  The 15 minute web training is to fast and not of to much help.

Review.Titre: Positive and negative
Review.Contenu: Positive: 1 year after using Pro version, purchased Pro+ but Pro annual contract was automatically renewed and fee was charged. Request refund as no use Pro anymore then immediately respond (refunded). Customer oriented attitude is positiveNegative: When create Gantt Chart, the default appearance is not so good looking so manually adjusted. Then when update the data the appearance was retuned so every time, I need to modify the appearance. Any way to lock the appearance?

Review.Titre: Critical Path and Dependencies
Review.Contenu: I purchased the pro plus license because I really wanted to use the Critical Path and Dependencies, but I find it hard to use and a little clunky, even after a live session with a representative. It's not very intuitive, and the import doesn't allow you to define dependencies, which would be very helpful.

Review.Titre: its quick and easy to adapt a schedule…
Review.Contenu: its quick and easy to adapt a schedule but to update a schedule is very manual we mainly use it to quote and when refreshing you have to  go through and manually change all the start date it take a lot of time

Review.Titre: The app is buggy and some changes when…
Review.Contenu: The app is buggy and some changes when you edit data don't stick unless you delete the line and add a new line. There's a lot of promise and I do want to use it. But some features need a bit more work.

Review.Titre: Good but Difficult and Time Consuming.
Review.Contenu: I like the look of it once the timeline is complete but it takes FOREVER to get to the final piece.  I dont like that you can't change the height or spacing manually without it changing the DATE range.

Review.Titre: It was hard to create a slide
Review.Contenu: It was hard to create a slide from my timeline. It took me about 4 hours to manually move them around to fit the aludea. This was my 1st time using it. Also I wish I would have know about the online license before I purchased the desktop version. Now I have 2 licenses.

Review.Titre: Its hard to adjust the timeline (more…
Review.Contenu: Its hard to adjust the timeline (more than one place to do it and something can change in THATa place and another thing can change in THATb place . I often want to change date, what shows, how it shows, move ... but it is hard to do

Review.Titre: Perfroamnce and usage
Review.Contenu: hi the performance with Timeline is very slow It's difficult to aligne objets task by task

Review.Titre: Price increase of +50$ in a year
Review.Contenu: Price increase of +50$ in a year. +50.51% and no more feature.This new price point is definitely a game changer for me.After 3 years , i will not buy your product anymore.

Review.Titre: Quite expensive for the features offered
Hello;
Review.Contenu: Hello;There are some problems regarding the working and calendars days calculations..

Review.Titre: I love how nice the product looks
Review.Contenu: I love how nice the product looks - there are two things that could be improved:1- I'm unable to add all the months when is it's beyond 1 year timeline. I understand it might be two much for a 2 year timeline but 13-18 months, could be nice to have all the months. 2- I make changes with ppt. (because of the above) and every time, I go back to timelinepro, my changes are gone. This is a lot of redo work.

Review.Titre: It's so ugly
Review.Contenu: It's so ugly? I appreciate how easy it is to use, but my god, on the basic subscription the colors and overall design looks extremely dated--I'm almost embarrassed to show stuff to clients. For what this is, it's too expensive. I dropped so much money on the subscription, I feel like I have to keep using it but likely wont subscribe again.

Review.Titre: Switching OS is not the same experience
Review.Contenu: Using the sw on windows machine was fantastic. Had the options I needed. When I switched to Mac or web version was mission the options and felt limited. I’m also struggling to implement in Google docs and may resort to converting to pdf. This was so flexible on windows and I am missing the options in other os.

Review.Titre: Questions about the template
Review.Contenu: I have tired to connect to support but no one replied.1.Does the ppt template support company' master one which should be included logo,deligated font format etc?2.Can the created file be reconfigured some values like tasks name etc by others who does not install your add-on?3.What will happen to created files after licence expired?

Review.Titre: It works ok for simple things and looks…
Review.Contenu: It works ok for simple things and looks ok. But it presents too big when you have a number of tasks selected. and that is odd too. it only shows a few of the tasks and milestones I need. so I always need to do a subset of what I need and use multiple pages and plans. I may not know how to use it to its fullest potential but the basics really don't do what I need well. options are limited on how I can present it.

Review.Titre: some basic features are missing
Review.Contenu: some basic features are missing, for example, if I would like to increase the visual size of all the durations of the tasks, and to align the writing next to it to be written in 1 line in automatic button - I don't have that option. today I have to do it manually, one task at a time. also - if I make a change in the Gantt it will not automatically be displayed in the power point - i have to recreate my chart all over againthanks

Review.Titre: The tool is great but the pricing is over the top
Review.Contenu: The tool is great but the pricing is way over the top. I can get a full subscription for Microsoft365 that I can install on 5 computers at the same price like the subscription fee of this tool.Yes it saves me time but the price is just out of balance

Review.Titre: I would give a 5 but...
Review.Contenu: I absolutely love this tool. My only issue is that I use a Mac and can only use the online version which is to basic for my needs.   So I have to move to PC to do any work using the tool. It's too cumbersome.  I really need a Pro version for Mac ASAP please :-). Then I can give you a 5 star!

Review.Titre: Development areas
Review.Contenu: It's great if you add functions like:- Adjust gantt chart period not only longer than data imported but also shorter- Keep format once it's settled even when another dataset imported, that would be very useful for monthly update (i.e. to import original data monthly)

Review.Titre: Great presentation but ease of use can be improved
Review.Contenu: For presentation purposes - I *love* this tool. Customers find its presentation clean and very useful. However, editing data in the Powerpoint application is difficult. If I want to shift all dates, it must be done manually. To circumvent this I export to Excel and write formulas and then reupload. To take this to the next level, I'd focus on ease-of-use from this type of lens.

Review.Titre: Pretty pictures with further improvement opportunities
Review.Contenu: The tool does impressive timeline diagrams. Few improvements I would like to see are:- Sequential tasks can be arranged automatically in a single row/line instead of having separate row for each of the tasks. This would present a better view of the dependent (sequential) tasks and also save space (real estate). Currently I find this very limiting for my use.- More flexibility in task width (custom doesn't work consistently) and other custom fields.

Review.Titre: I find it to be useful minimizing…but have to make sync work consistently
Review.Contenu: I find it to be useful minimizing manual steps in syncing with MS Project. However, the sync does not work many times and have to close down applications and reopen for the sync to work.  This makes me NOT trust when things do sync up (always retesting)_.

Review.Titre: I'm using the online app and it is…
Review.Contenu: I'm using the online app and it is fairly limited in the way it can present things. Not having swimlanes feature on the online app is also an issue. There doesn't seem to be a clear way to upgrade the online app purchase to a PPT plug-in which would be something I would do at this point considering all the additional features that are available.

Review.Titre: to each his own
Review.Contenu: The office timeline is not very user-friendly.  Every time I add a timeline and then make a change to it, it constantly pushes my timeline off the slide then I had to readjust everything all over again.    And the accept manual changes button is pointless as it does nothing.  At the end of the day, I am better off making my own timeline by just adding the shapes to the slide myself.

Review.Titre: Please fix your program!
Review.Contenu: Overall, the program is useful, BUT... there are many bugs that combined with the latest Office 365 make this program difficult to use.  It crashes quite often which causes me to reboot the program which shuts down all Powerpoint windows.  There are too many bugs to list here, but needless to say, please fix them!  Your program has much promise but the implementation is frustrating.  I am one of many at my company who also feel the same.

Review.Titre: The tool really is wonderful and totally worth the low cost...
Review.Contenu: The tool really is wonderful and totally worth the cost. But I can't give it more than 3 stars because (a) it's pretty slow, so if you want to make a lot of changes, you end up doing a lot of waiting for either the input screen to load or the updated timeline to "paint" on the screen. And (b) there are limitations with formatting that I find disappointing. Nothing that I can't live with, but there's lots of room for improvement.

Review.Titre: The timeline is not intuitive
Review.Contenu: The timeline is not intuitive. It is kind of clunky in how to manipulate the timeline once you have selected a template. I have only just downloaded the app and used it a few times. I took the online tutorial but still having trouble loving it. Maybe if I work with it a little more.

Review.Titre: We really have not used it yet
Review.Contenu: We really have not used it yet, but looks like the type of solution we need. We will be using it primarily for grant applications and funder reporting because of the ability to create a graphic representation of a timeline instead of creating a workaround in Excel, Publisher, or Word.

Review.Titre: Importing | Copy-Pasting from Excel to…
Review.Contenu: Importing | Copy-Pasting from Excel to OTL does not reflect all line-items. Usually milestones do not get acknowledged. For me the amount of manual work is too extended for initial timeline. Maintenance thereafter is fine. - Idea worth spreading: If OTL would offer integration of SwimLanes for planning would help a lot. And the option to view Planning as KANBAN would be impressive. - Thanks for your work.

Review.Titre: A few tweaks to go from good to great are needed
Review.Contenu: I think OT would be phenomenal if it worked like it should, but when i add a new task/milestone it shifts everything around way too much. It also doesn't do a good job on the front end with spacing out the dates. You have to format too much. You should have an option to choose a paper size (8.5x11, 11x17, etc.) and it should fill up that space.

Review.Titre: I really like the current functionality, but need Mac OS functionality for MS Project.
Review.Contenu: I really like the current functionality of Office Timeline and it provides a good selection of default Timeline themes to select from.  Two of the lacking features/functionalities that I hope to see in an upcoming release is the ability to pull additional tasks from MS Project.  The current release has a limitation.  The most important functionality that is needed is the ability to work with Mac OS.

Review.Titre: I like the product
Review.Contenu: I like the product, but two issues:  (1) it's often buggy when trying to upload data; (2) the process of selecting a template, and then having that template actually populate into the presentation is difficult and is not intuitive. In fact, I haven't figured it out yet. But, with that being said, for turning excel data into a timeline--works great.

Review.Titre: OK for small projects and not as intuitive as it could be.
Review.Contenu: This product is good is you have a simple and small project. Very difficult to add bigger programme on to one page and the tool is not intelligent enough to try and condense the visuals.Also if you make any manual layout changes to the plan the changes revert back to the default layout if you make updates. The tool does not remember and save your previous saved manual layout.

Review.Titre: Very good Idea and very helpful ...
Review.Contenu: Very good Idea and very helpful ......but with the newest Win10, Office365 ClickToRun, full screen and a multi monitor environment some setup windows open in a hidden space and are therefore not usable. Current workaround ... make the PowerPoint window really small, open the setup window, pick the small peace of the setup windows that shows up and move it to be fully displayed.

Review.Titre: Should not need to repurchase to get upgrade
Review.Contenu: I love office timeline....I did not like, though, that I had to repurchase it in order to get the upgrade.UPDATE: Now that I have read the reason for needing to repurchase, I am not very happy. I have been an Office Timeline user for years. Those of us that purchased the product years ago (and supported development with the purchase) should have been grandfathered into the new subscription model...or at least offered a discount.

Review.Titre: Nice tool, but didn't work for me.
Review.Contenu: Timeline seems to be created with a specific set of use cases.  I was hoping to be able to retrofit a 4 year schedule that currently lives as PPT graphics into something more automated, but I was unable to find a way to get timeline to split up into 4 separate timelines and still neatly display all milestones on one page.  The tool was overall easy to use, just didn't work for my use case.

Review.Titre: I like it ... and there is a potential for me to love it!
Review.Contenu: I really like the product, and it has the potential to be very, very helpful. Like with most things, repeat use is the key to seamless integration.  A menu-driven functionality would make it easier for me because my issue is that I may only use the Timeline once every six weeks.  After six weeks of non-use, I am almost starting over on the learning curve.  A more menu-driven feature may help reduce barriers to more high-powered use.

Review.Titre: Overall useful to have in my project…
Review.Contenu: Overall useful to have in my project management planning and communications. It's still a bit clunky and can use some work to give the end user more opportunities to customize to fit needs. I'd like it to better fit with Microsofts color pallet and be able to move objects around without taking everything apart piece by piece.

Review.Titre: I wish it could the changes made to PPT…
Review.Contenu: I wish it could the changes made to PPT to push online and push to PPT would have the ability to change in PPT.  Also, it would be nice to create folders structure. Allow for people who are shared can make copy of an timeline for a new version. Sharing requires an extra step of accepting though email.

Review.Titre: This is a good product that saves me a…
Review.Contenu: This is a good product that saves me a lot of time. The only reason I gave it three stars is that it occasionally locks up while editing an existing file and "beeps" every time you try change something. When that happens the only way out is to cancel powerepoint which results in lost work.

Review.Titre: Very good product
Review.Contenu: Very good product, but careful when editing timelines... things can move around a little on you after the initial setup.  The formatting is superb, but can get a little out of whack if you try to tweak it by hand.  That stated, this is BY FAR the best product of its type I was able to find.  Keep up the great work!

Review.Titre: Decent tool, but a lot of room for improvement
Review.Contenu: Big issue with color management. If you have to follow graphic guidelines, you will have to enter the RGB values each and every time you will need to apply them to any object.On a more global level, it would be nice to have a WYSIWYG tool rather than a wizard which computes data after your enter it.Last thing : it would be nice to be able to create a task tree. The only way to make a task appear as a child to another one is to use graphic tools, but it is uneasy.

Review.Titre: The add in slows the process when…
Review.Contenu: The add in slows the process when trying to open or work with PPT files. This makes for a cumbersome experience. Also, I can think of numerous features that can be added that would go a long way in making this a complete tool for project managenent... If that is your goal. Having said that.. the tool has it's uses but can be developed further. Otherwise it may become redundant given the fast paced changes that we are seeing in terms of tools and technology these days .

Review.Titre: A great start - much more work to do!
Review.Contenu: I need to be able to colloborate with others, ideally without them having to also subscribe.Data needs to integrate with other sources, O365 Excel spreadsheets, etc, Microsoft Flow integration would be awesome.Alternative visualizations, charts, etc all driven from data sources I can easily extract data to.

Review.Titre: I really like the template option
Review.Contenu: I really like the template option. However, one of the drawbacks is that any text or items moved in the slide revert back to their original positions when using the edit features in the plug in.

Review.Titre: No introduction or directions how to …
Review.Contenu: No introduction or directions how to use the application.As soon as I started to use it first time, updates and commercial offers (e.g. for specific additional ?? templates) were being pushed.  Everytime this happens, it blocks my computer and I need to call IT support as we have no administrator rights for our company computers.

Review.Titre: Difficult to customize
Review.Contenu: I find MS Office Timeline to be the program of choice when preparing project timelines for clear presentation and planning. However, I find it extremely frustrating that if you make any manual changes or formatting to the timeline and then need to update a date, that all your formatting is lost and must be redone.

Review.Titre: This application imports MS Project …
Review.Contenu: This application imports MS Project into PowerPoint. It saves substantial time that it would take manually. The S/W still has relatively few choices for how to display Project Data in  PowerPoint. For example, all manipulations with the Timeline and the Milestones can only be done in the original Timeline position. If the Timeline is moved from the original position then every manipulation of the milestones and tasks will make the timeline jump back to the original position.

Review.Titre: I use PowerPoint once a week to report TIMELINE IS FRUSTRATING
Review.Contenu: I use PowerPoint once a week to report project status instead of pdf's from Microsoft Project, and though it let me update timeline dates initially, it won't allow me to update the dates anymore and task(s) come in early, or are delivered late.Frustrating to have to log in (I think) to get the product to work.Once I purchase, it should be as easy to use as originally, AND become a stable and available part of my copy of PPT until it expires or something like that.

Review.Titre: A lot of upgrades needed
Review.Contenu: It takes a lot of time to update the timeline after changesAny changes outside the app are not savedThere are not plenty of color, fonts, text position optionsIt would be great to be able to hide whole swim lanes, not only individual tasksMore expert training should be developed

Review.Titre: •	Accepting manual changes use to …
Review.Contenu: •	Accepting manual changes use to change all settings done on the page. Have to redo things again and again. •	Couldn't find all templates when intended to change from change icon. Only typical options were available. •	Its good add in, still needs a lot of improvement and pricing also needs reviewing. •	Per year subscription is expansive, considering price tag the expectations were much higher. More functionalities is needed to add. Compare to office suite per year subscription is very high.

Review.Titre: If you just need the basic function …
Review.Contenu: If you just need the basic function that the add-in talks about then this is the tool for you.  I liked it, I would recommend this to a co-worker but I would include some discussion around the software limitations. Overall great software but they have room for development to make it an extremely powerful tool.

Review.Titre: Good tool in general.
Review.Contenu: Good tool in general.I would like to see a possibility to add some extra information as an option to timeline. Like just free text or possibility to add own field like classification or something like that. Based on classification it would be nice to have same colors in timeline for same classes. Thanks.

Review.Titre: Good but more visual features needed
Review.Contenu: I think the tool is very helpful but I would like to have some more visual timelines/roadmaps without real time goals and more like steps or rows of actions to visualize projects or actions list in more high level and with more “management acceptance”

Review.Titre: The concept is excellent, however
Review.Contenu: The concept is excellent.  However, I like/need to do custom formatting in PowerPoint, ie moving things, spacing, font sizing, etc, but each time I make a change in editing, it resets the formatting and I have to redo my customized formatting.  It can be time consuming.

Review.Titre: The results are fairly easy to get to…
Review.Contenu: The results are fairly easy to get to and Timeline's Powerpoint slides look really nice.  There isn't as much room on a slide for the tasks we'd like to show, so consolidation was necessary.  We'd purchase the product again and indeed, we'd pay for an upgrade.

Review.Titre: To much money for what you get
Review.Contenu: To much money for what you get. The idea is good, but I cant find to much on the internet to learn about all the possibilities. Maybe I looked at the wrong places ? If I change the start date will all other milestones dates shift to ?How dynamic can I make it ? Or is it only static ?

Review.Titre: The main weakness of the current …
Review.Contenu: The main weakness of the current version is that there are no dependencies between tasks. If you change one date you need to change all the others that are associated manually. This is time consuming and has a high probability of errors.In addition to that, it is possible to change the format of a single text box, but it is not possible to keep the desired format/position of the single task boxes. So at each refresh all the customizations are lost. More flexibility and few improvements will help to have a more user friendly product.

Review.Titre: Not a bad tool for conveying timelines…
Review.Contenu: Not a bad tool for conveying timelines for projects at a high level.  The tool is easy to use and intuitive but is certainly not able to convey project elements in any detail as it struggles when it comes to displaying larger numbers of line items.

Review.Titre: Office Timeline enhancement
Review.Contenu: The timeline creation is nice, but I need to edit the timeline to  effectively communicate our needs. Every time I do, it timeline reverts back to the original format, which limits my use of it.  It would be helpful to ask users if they want to keep their edits.

Review.Titre: the timeline is very nice
Review.Contenu: the timeline is very nice, could use a few more customization options, but overall nice. The major drawback is that it hangs a lot when opening slides with timelines on them. Opening and editing the data often takes 10 seconds or more. Saving changes is likewise slow.

Review.Titre: The software is bit buggy
Review.Contenu: The software is bit buggy. I had issues with the installation and at first half the options weren't available to me. I had to uninstall and re-install. It works better now but every time I open powerpoint I have to go to my add-on manager and push it enable.

Review.Titre: timeline is a very good plan
Review.Contenu: timeline is a very good plan, where execution lacks of the same powerIt's helpful in making order when you're handling so many dates and milestones. Unfortunately software seems to be a little bit stiff, not always  flexible enough for typical .ppt business purposes (i.e. when the time lapse is more 1Y and project is plenty of milestones/events grahic choices appear poor and limited). I deem it still remain a good idea, and potentially very useful even if in much more limited range of cases than you expected. It's just a little bit too expensive for what you can do through it

Review.Titre: Solid product but has it's frustrations
Review.Contenu: Solid product to help reduce the pain of visualizing timelines.  However, timeline management screen is very buggy when on a two monitor setup.  Also takes multiple hoops to compact or redesign layouts to better fit slides.  Ideally I would be able to download/upload large changes into the same chart... any upload creates a new slide, which means having to repeat all the formatting edits all over again - which can be significant!   Does it save me time? absolutely and a decent bit.  It is frustrating to use?  Yes, there are sufficient bugs/oversights that make it a very middle of the road product that just tips the scale on benefits v. cons.  This review is against BUILD number 5.01

Review.Titre: Office Timeline Templates
Review.Contenu: Hi, this is a great tool, but it is not a user friendly as it should be, in my opinion, specially for the creation of the templates and the templates which are already defined.Have a nice day

Review.Titre: I am confused by the subscription…
Review.Contenu: I am confused by the subscription emails.  I want to use the application but do not understand if I am using a lesser application or a pro application.  I will not go through this process to renew next year, there are other tools I'll use.

Review.Titre: ITs not intuitive
Review.Contenu: ITs not intuitive, whenever I customize a timeline, it gets messed up, I spend too much time making the timelines presentable. I really need some support to be able to adjust the timelines to look presentable.

Review.Titre: I love the timeline concept but there are so…
Review.Contenu: I love the timeline but there are so many fundamental issues when changing the timeline...and it's really a lot to type. If someone would like to call me to receive the information, I'm happy to do that.

Review.Titre: Suggested approvements
Review.Contenu: The product and the idea is great. It is a very simple way to create new timelines and I think the product has great potential. However, the product needs to develop. Here are a few issues:- If you change the dateformat in a timeline, it will not follow when you create new tasks to the timeline.- I miss a possiblility to set my own settings in terms of layout and dateformats, that I always want to be default.- If I want to split the tasks in the timeline for some reason, (example that the upper tasks belong to one project and the lower another) I would like to have the possibility to mark or divide tasks.

Review.Titre: Useful product but requires patience
Review.Contenu: I really like office timeline, I have found it to be super useful when we need a quick visual of project plans. However, when I make changes to the timeline or shift things around, it causes long delays and powerpoint doesn't always respond

Review.Titre: The concept is great
Review.Contenu: The concept is great - would like to see the cosmetics worked out a bit more.  Specifically where you have parent activities and sub tasks.  But overall find it is a very useful tool in providing clean professional timelines via ppt.

Review.Titre: It's a nice basic timeline with some flaws
Review.Contenu: It's a nice basic timeline, but there are 2 significant issues that bother me (I) I copied a PowerPoint slide to copy the timeline format, updated all the tasks and related details to the new project. However, when I made an adjustment later it added back all the information from the original timeline - annoying(ii) when I manually move details, heading/dates/milestones on the timeline and click the Green Check Arrow to confirm my changes, then changes don't stickThe result is when it works it does what it says on the tin, but when it doesn't I wish I'd just made it our of shapes from PowerPoint instead

Review.Titre: Good product but I would like to see…
Review.Contenu: Good product but I would like to see changes to dates ripple through following tasks. This is a huge problem. Much less important to have lines with arrows option to connect critical path tasks elsewhere on the chart.

Review.Titre: The time date setted always go back to …
Review.Contenu: The time date setted always go back to the beginning of each month. E.g The activity start from Jan, 15 end at Jan, 28. then we open this timeline file again, the start date automatically back to Jan, 01.  I don't know why?RegardJeff

Review.Titre: Office Timeline works as advertised but…
Review.Contenu: Office Timeline works as advertised but it is a narrow band of value-add. Would be attractive to a broader group of users if it supported more uses. Examples: more dynamic powerpoint presentations, interface with Visio,

Review.Titre: This program shows promise but is lacking right now
Review.Contenu: This program shows promise, but it really doesn't deliver the functions I needed, so far as I can tell. I am looking for a timeline that is built of historical events (not a future to-do list sort of timeline), which can accommodate potentially hundreds of individual data points, and which one can then zoom in on a smaller sub-set of those points. Several data points are only minutes or seconds apart, so once they are piled on the screen the user can not distinguish the various points. Maybe this is not the functionality you're aiming for, in which case it would be nice to overtly describe that it doesn't do these things.

Review.Titre: Normally great, but the last rev, not as good as the last
Review.Contenu: Hi - Last version was awesome! This version I am getting more imports into PPT that are not a Timeline object which is a bummer. Prior to the last upgrade, I consider this my secret PM ninja tool. I know you guys will figure this out!

Review.Titre: Office Timeline Cloud Version OK but not Great, Desktop version Great
Review.Contenu: While 3 Stars it really is close to a 5 when compared to the competition.I had previously used the Office Timeline Desktop Version for the past couple of years and found it great for quick project updates.The cloud version slow and some features are missing.Licensing it would of been worth an extra few $'s if the license provided cloud and desktop client as a single license plus the ability to purchase lifetime updates.Enhancements intergration to Viso and Excel Timelines rather than just PowerPoint would be fantastic.If you are looking for an easy to use tool to present quick timeline this is a must but check both demos to get the version that suites you.

Review.Titre: - I think a video of each template with …
Review.Contenu: - I think a video of each template with how-to's would be helpful.  I had to really manipulate the slides to get them to be presentable. - I wasn't happy with my final result - I like the fact that mspp can be uploaded

Review.Titre: I'm brand new to Office Timeline
Review.Contenu: I'm brand new to Office Timeline.  My experience is limited but, so far, I really, really, really like it.  I really, really, really don't like that it costs so much more just to get the Swim Lanes feature.

Review.Titre: I like office timeline a lot but it…
Review.Contenu: I like office timeline a lot but it still needs some tweaking. My Gantt Chart is long and as a result it will move out of the boundary on the power point slide. I wish that could be fixed. Also my milestone dates are close together and sometimes the text will collide with another milestone's line. If I move to timeline up a little, the timeline and gantt chart are completely disorganized from that point on. I can not make any significant design changes because the text and pictures will overlap each other. This being said online timeline offer a much better solution to designing timelines than Microsoft project. I hope these issues can be fixed in subsequent builds.

Review.Titre: Office Timeline Review
Review.Contenu: It helps you automate the making of nice charts. The outcomes are fantastic. There is some learning curve and it is easy to make fatal mistakes that force you to start over. I expect it will get better with future updates.

Review.Titre: It is useful only if utilized by…
Review.Contenu: It is useful only if utilized by copying data from other apps like Wrike or project.The import from project works only partially as swim lanes are not supported. That was the best feature to have available.

Review.Titre: Feature
Review.Contenu: Hello - Just an idea on features.  Date format for Tasks - Please add an option for only displaying the month.  Meaning "Nov" Only option includes the year "Nov 2024"  The year is obvious in the timescale bar.  So repeating the year on the task is redundant takes up valuable Slide Real Estate.

Review.Titre: Amazing tool!
Review.Contenu: This is a really great tool! As a program manager, I rely on timelines really heavily! I the abilities that timeline allows that other tools don't or don't allow as intuitively. One suggestion is that sometimes the formats get too large for slides. It would be great if there were more options to fit the visual to the slides differently.

Review.Titre: Great tool for executive presentation
Review.Contenu: I like that I have multiple templates to choose from.  Officetimeline has been my go-to tool for executive presentations since I learned about it about 5 years ago.  I only wish you could add dependencies in the online version.

Review.Titre: Saves soooo much time
Review.Contenu: Saves soooo much time creating timeline presentations from MS project schedule

Review.Titre: Could have been 5 stars but ...
Review.Contenu: Could have been 5 stars but ...Every time I open Powerpoint, I had to enter the license in order for the features to be available. Export function should retain configuration of each task/milestone (shape and color at a minimum) so when Uploaded again, there are less cosmetic changes need to be made. I also keep hitting some Upload issues where some rows can't be ported over. Providing reasons why would help.Overall, though your app has made my life better. This app has reduced my work time by 50%. I believe I can get 75% time reduction if the Upload function is improved.

Review.Titre: It is a well designed and intuitive…
Review.Contenu: It is a well designed and intuitive add-on. I use it with Smartsheet. The search is a bit slow, when you choose the sheet using search. Also when the program putsThe labels on the bars, it ignores the boundaries of the chart or the object and writes over bars or spills outside of the chart area. Not minor and I fix it manually. (I like the manual change option provided)

Review.Titre: Great
Review.Contenu: Great. could be even better if you improve basic things such as being able to adjust the horizontal positioning of the timeline. or better yet do it similar to Thinkcell where the user defines the position and size of the object by clicking and dragging.

Review.Titre: In verry limited tim you can create all
Review.Contenu: In verry limited tim you can create allSorts of timelines. Using this tool the effort goes into actual planning instead of deciding on what form to use and draw this out.

Review.Titre: Timeline works great
Review.Contenu: Timeline works great.  It's a fairly seamless solution for building and managing timelines for our organization.This is actually the third time I've purchased it for my organization, and every time other people see it at work, and they want a license, as well. The only issue I have run into is that it keeps losing the current license, meaning I need to look up the license and re-enter it to use Timeline.

Review.Titre: İ belive that some functionality such…
Review.Contenu: İ belive that some functionality such as baseline vs plan compare and visualizing that will be good. Baseline 1,2,3 and plan start/finish etc.Using project calendar or resource calendarEven project desktop, also microsoft project for web or project online integration that will be so good.additional templates to inspire and automation.So many company use jira datacenter or some other tools if the system provide rest api json call to gathering data that will be usefull. Actually there are a lot of things but good job guys. İ use it, love it. Almost 5-6 years ago i use it free version and also i suggest you to a lot of company in Turkey.

Review.Titre: Love that I can export from Smartsheet
Review.Contenu: Love that I can export from Smartsheet. This is a great way to create a presentation based on Project milestones and/or key deliverables. It would be wonderful if multiple PowerPoint pages are required to display the Office Timeline presentation that this was more automated. Editing is a little arduous. That said, Office Timeline is a fabulous tool to help present Exec Project Summaries from the detailed plan.The Office Timeline Team are delightful and so very helpful and knowledgeable in their introduction session for new users.

Review.Titre: Great timeline tool
Review.Contenu: Pros1. Great templates2. Easy to import dataCons1. Editing data for previously create timeline is more manual than expected. 2. Would be nice to have flexibility to add additional % field to show percentage progression.

Review.Titre: There are two features I would like to…
Review.Contenu: There are two features I would like to see:1.  Option to "fix" the vertical and horizontal margins of the chart so as to eliminate having to adjust these margins after updating data.2.  Option to automatically update data from source spreadsheet upon opening the PPT file.  Currently, one needs to click on update data to accomplish this.

Review.Titre: Amazing Timeline Tool
Review.Contenu: This tool makes creating my timelines so much easier and faster.  I love that I can update it by simply change a date.  I've been using the free version for several years and recently update to the Pro version due to my projects becoming more complex.  I love the swim lanes feature but was disappointed when I discovered adding levels to a swimlane required yet another upgrade.

Review.Titre: Great product, minor nits
Review.Contenu: This is a great product and nothing comes close for options, professional results, and ease of use. I do feel I have to deduct one star because it constantly pops up with: Style Pane, and offers for consulting work with the company. I know Style Pane can be disabled, and probably the ad as well, but man, I bought the full package I don't want to hear about other services every time I use it as a default. Secondly, sometimes it lays out longer task names oddly, but pretty easy to fix by hand. Again highly recommend overall and great money spent for any professional.

Review.Titre: Easy to use and great visuals
Review.Contenu: Easy to use and great visuals! The only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is that I wish there were some easier ways/tools to make changes to the final visuals... text size, fonts, etc. The latest version did address some of this, but I find myself getting the format how I want on the slide, then going back and updating a date or two and having to re-do the formatting again.

Review.Titre: I've just started using this
Review.Contenu: I've just started using this, so I don't know much yet. What I'm hoping it will provide is a good middle ground between MS Project which is cumbersome and more detailed than I need for most projects, and writing out a schedule in an email.

Review.Titre: Mac functionality would be good
Review.Contenu: Mac functionality would be good – and control over how the time scale is broken up. Very helpful when I’ve emailed with questions. Excellent product. Great visuals.

Review.Titre: Office timeline is relatively easy to learn and use
Review.Contenu: Office timeline is relatively easy to use and intuitive. The learning curve is short in terms of getting straight out of the box results.There is one annoying bug which essentially resets your character and object position changes when the user opens and closes the timeline menus.

Review.Titre: Intuitive and easy to use.
Review.Contenu: The tool was intuitive and easy to use. It works great for shorter timelines, but my first timeline was a 5-year project with more than 50 tasks, which seemed to push the tools graphical limits. The tool gave me a great starting point, but eventually, I did have to disable the auto-update feature to manually adjust text orientation and make it fit within the space I had available. I will definitely use this tool again and hope to make the graphics without so much customization.

Review.Titre: Great App to make boring Gantt Charts Exciting!
Review.Contenu: I have used the Office Timeline app to create "swimlane" work breakdown structures for presentation to Stakeholders. They appreciate the breakout of responsibilities on our projects. I found the app somewhat confusing at first, especially in dealing with data, but soon learned how to make things work out. I have yet to use all the templates..

Review.Titre: It's an intuitive and easy to use tool
Review.Contenu: It's an intuitive and easy to use tool.   I've used it to create many charts for nice looking presentations over the past several years.   I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars because, as with any software, there are things I want to make it do that it's not designed to.  Specific custom additions added to a diagram, etc.  for that I can use other tools.

Review.Titre: Office Timeline has been a great help…
Review.Contenu: Office Timeline has been a great help to us in presenting project schedules in a more visually appealing way.  GANTT charts a too cumbersome for a management presentation and Office Timeline has helped quite a bit.An area for improvement though would be the addition of baseline v actual.  This is what senior managers and executives want to see.

Review.Titre: Good integration with PowerPoint and Smartsheets
Review.Contenu: Product has evolved over the past few years.  Best way to show a schedule in PowerPoint to senior mgmt w/o making it an eye chart exam.  Integration with Smartsheet.com makes for a very low effort workflow to share updates.

Review.Titre: Almost perfect
Review.Contenu: Almost perfect. Great service and application however some nuances which make it frustrating to use:- When using the desktop application, if you try to fit the timeline in a custom slide, it's one of the most challenging things to do- still doesn't have dependencies logic built in like smartsheet. makes adjusting timelines a nightmare if already imported into Office Timeline- No option for timeline to show every monthThose are the major challenges we have with Office Timeline -- there are some other quirks which are annoyances but the those are the top three. Regardless, if you know your way around applications and design, you can still make the necessary adjustments requirements.

Review.Titre: Office Timeline Pro+ & Smartsheet timelines
Review.Contenu: I use Office Timeline Pro+ pull data in from Smartsheet to build timelines.  The timelines are great and save a lot of time when producing presentations for the executive team.  I have built a few customized templates, which are finicky and a little glitchy.  Overall I am happy with the product; looking forward to the day (hopefully soon) that they have the glitches smoothed out.

Review.Titre: Easily can create a great looking &…
Review.Contenu: Easily can create a great looking & well-organized timeline. The best thing I like is importing data from Project file. One other great thing is creating own template, can create a master template for a company, and apply for many projects.

Review.Titre: Product is having a positive impact
Review.Contenu: I love the product and it is having a real impact on how we are working – the whole company is now working from aligned plans rather than there being multiple slidesets floating around with slightly misaligned assumptions.It is a little fiddly, but I find the effort is worth it.

Review.Titre: This is my go-to tool
Review.Contenu: This is my go-to tool above several others because of the import and control options with some of the most modern feel. I was happy to see the update for more swimlane functions. I would love to see the feature support Mac as that is my preferred system. Also, an improved import from Smartsheet would be extremely valuable in the future.

Review.Titre: Improvement over visio and excel
Review.Contenu: I have been using visio and excel to create roadmaps and timelines, office timeline pro makes it a lot easier to manage and my management team loves the format. The only gripe i have is there does not seem to be a way to import a template without importing the bogus data in the template. It would be great to just import the design format. Easy to clean up but a hassle none-the-less.

Review.Titre: Great
Review.Contenu: Great! Very helpful. Except the content should auto-size for big projects with multiple activities and phases. But the most important issue is pro edition is very expensive. Please offer lower prices.

Review.Titre: Using office timeline in pharma
Review.Contenu: Office timeline allows me to use powerpoint features together with keeping track of timeline dates. It is very convenient for those proficient in ppt. The free version was not good to test the program, but office timeline pro works very well for me

Review.Titre: UPDATED: The tool errors out when trying to add…
Review.Contenu: The tool errors out when trying to add a custom color.Edited as I can't reply to the reply:The issue I'm having is when I'm in "Edit Data" view. When I click on the task or milestone color --> custom color --> then click on one, the edit task/milestone box abruptly closes. I believe this is a software glitch and not an issue with clicking "accept changes" or clicking "okay."

Review.Titre: Love the product
Review.Contenu: Love the product.  I keep using from client to client.  I have a problem though because I have to use a different user ID with each client, so it involves a new license.  That gets expensive, plus of course the price is up to $150 now.The price though is still a very good value.

Review.Titre: Office Timeline is solid
Review.Contenu: Office Timeline is solid!  It is easier than Project or Excel for internally managing a changing schedule, and it creates customer-ready visuals for free.I'm not an expert user, but it did not seem to support task dependencies and so each task's date range had to be managed individually.

Review.Titre: Life Changing (sic)
Review.Contenu: The product literally saves hours of effort - especially when edits must be made. I used to use Excel for the same purpose - it's a night and day comparison. It has some rough edges that could be improved, but it's a solid tool for the purpose.

Review.Titre: Good Day - my concerns area to fix/investigate
Review.Contenu: Good Day, i really enjoy your product and have used it for 2 years, however there are some issues!1) i could not find a way to upgrade from the basic to pro without paying full price again, eg: the basic is 60 dollars and the pro is 100, but if i buy basic and then want pro i need to pay the full 100, there should be the option to upgrade for the outstanding 40.2) if someone starts a timeline in basic and is sent to me for approval and i make a change using pro then then it can no longer be edited buy a basic user, this seems like a money making "scam" to force people to upgrade (again with a full price).Both these examples happened to me and is costly for small companies.

Review.Titre: The tool is really powerful and helps a…
Review.Contenu: The tool is really powerful and helps a lot, to save time for presenting complex timelines. However, the import functionality from MS Project needs to improved. I tryied it several times now, but came to the conclusion, that is for an unfortunate not presenting the chart as per my wishes - means it takes to much effort to rework the imported chart in timeline - therefore its always faster, to create the same chart from the scratch. Further, the dependency functionality is not given like in MS Project. It would be a great add to have the functionality of predecessor of a Task/Milestone in it.

Review.Titre: Fast, Easy, Powerful Communications Tool
Review.Contenu: This is a great product. I started with the free trial version a number of years ago and worked my way up to the Pro+. It is a fast and simple way to create a powerful scheduling tool without the challenge of using  complex MS Project type tools.

Review.Titre: Easy to Use and Manipulate Visually
Review.Contenu: Easy to use and manipulate the data and chart organization. This is a simpler tool than something like P6 or Project to create a timeline vs an in-depth Gantt chart. I would put this in the category of a representative/visual tool useful for providing a high level representation.

Review.Titre: Center Gantt on Slide
Review.Contenu: Center Gantt on SlideIt would be great to have an option to center the gantt chart on the slide. I always have to center everything after any adjustments are made. Hourly gantt chart for planned shutdowns.

Review.Titre: Solid Tool with Room to Grow
Review.Contenu: Office Timeline automated a previously manual process.  Its fairly easy to use the tools within Office Timeline.  There are some areas of opportunity for customization and has some oddities in how it populates the items within the roadmap, but overall this is a solid product.

Review.Titre: Nice Excel / Powerpoint GANTT solution
Review.Contenu: Needed a simple excel based solution to building GANTT charts and this nailed it. My only ask would be that the pricing was changed or made a little more clear as in the end I had to keep upgrading to get the functionality I needed.

Review.Titre: In general it's fairly easy to set up
Review.Contenu: In general it's fairly easy to set up.  However, if you want to shrink the entire timeline to fit a slide for example, that seems to be fairly difficult.  I am also having trouble with the linking of tasks.  I want to be able to change one date and have all the rest update.  But I can't seem to figure that our as well.  This is probably my issue.  But what I really like about the program is that I use it for clients - it's visually simple and I love having everything live in PowerPoint.  So that's super convienient.

Review.Titre: I liked using this website as a study…
Review.Contenu: I liked using this website as a study tool. The time was slightly difficult to navigate, but maybe I just cannot figure out how to set a time period frame. Overall great and super easy to use

Review.Titre: This product is great for creating professional timeline graphics
Review.Contenu: This product is great for creating executive presentations of timelines. It has a few quirks and is not cheap but the product does what it says and the results are very professional

Review.Titre: Format changes
Review.Contenu: One the biggest issue with Timeline is that every time I make a change to a date/descirpiotn, etc. the entire formatting that I created to match our company brand will go away and I have to redo them all.

Review.Titre: For high level gantt charts
Review.Contenu: For high level gantt charts - this works great.  For highly detailed charts that require multiple levels - it does not work as well for me.  I do not have the advanced subscription - so that may remedy the situation - but really don't want to have to pay more.

Review.Titre: A better, more user friendly experience …
Review.Contenu: I am always in search of a better simpler way to build gatt charts. This fits that bill. I like the interface and the simplicity.There are a few upgrades I would suggest, but I am very pleased  with with your current phase. I’d be happy to speak with someone to give feedback but I am excited about where you are heading.

Review.Titre: Very useful and easy to work with
Review.Contenu: Office Timeline is a very useful tool and easy to work with. It allows me to create clear and structured roadmaps in an easy way without losing a lot of time.

Review.Titre: Tool is very easy to use and install.
Review.Contenu: Tool is very easy to use and install.People in my team are using it extensively.Only improvement to suggest is if we could import from MS Project files.

Review.Titre: Good product for putting together a simple Gantt
Review.Contenu: Good product for putting together a simple Gantt chart.Still missing some tools that you can expect in project management SW

Review.Titre: Easy to develop timelines
Review.Contenu: Easy to develop timelines, and update when requires I have used it few times in work, everyone was impressed. I need to do more in-depth time lines to give it a 5

Review.Titre: Easy to use
Review.Contenu: Easy to use. The size of the page cannot be extended so when you export large gannts the are not very nice. I’m using the online version because I’m on MacOS.

Review.Titre: I find the program very useful
Review.Contenu: I find the program very useful, however, there are some features that are not so easy to be utilized.Perhaps a detailed tutorial would be helpful.

Review.Titre: Feedback
Review.Contenu: Easy to use, good integration with excel and MS project. However it would be nice to have more flexibility to select the items to visualize from an imported file.

Review.Titre: I found the product very useful and…
Review.Contenu: I found the product very useful and effective, there are a few suggestions that can offer.It was quite a large complex timeline for my first one, I did really enjoy the software and will continue to use it..  There were a few things I would recommend for improvements:•	Be able to show every year on the timeline instead of every two years.. I did find a work around and added some text boxes for the years that were missing but they have to go on at the very end as they will disappear.•	When exporting,  the duration shows in days..  my project spans over 15 years, so it would be better if the default duration could be changed from days to months or even years.•	Would be nice to be able to connect two tasks that are in different swim lanes, I know you can do this if all the text is all the way to the left….  But why not be able to do this regardless of where the text is.Of course these are just improvement suggestions and I am overall pleased with the software capabilities.

Review.Titre: I wanted to explore a new Campus…
Review.Contenu: I wanted to explore a new Campus license model with Jodie, which is common for the fundamental research area. Office Timeline was agreed on such a topic.

Review.Titre: Great product
Review.Contenu: Great product! I am able to spin up a high level timeline in minutes and edit on the fly! Would be really cool to get more templates and even import a project plan into it to automatically create timelines.

Review.Titre: This is a great plugin that works well
Review.Contenu: This is a great plugin that works well. Sure you could probably make the timelines on your own, but this saves so much time that you don’t have to spend fiddling with PowerPoint or Excel.

Review.Titre: Great add-on to PowerPoint
Review.Contenu: I am able to create roadmaps a lot easier with this product in PowerPoint. Very flexible in terms of presentation.

Review.Titre: Useful and Intuitive
Review.Contenu: Generally a good tool to use, and fairly quick to understand. No training required, just go ahead and set up those timelines.

Review.Titre: Great Product
Review.Contenu: This product is great, easy to use and produces high quality visuals. Saves a lot of time on formatting and re-aligning of graphics that used to be how I did this.

Review.Titre: A very easy and effective tool to use
Review.Contenu: A very easy and effective tool to use. The only con I see is some of the features could be a bit limited and editing could be difficult or hard to make stick.

Review.Titre: the features and functions in office…
Review.Contenu: the features and functions in office timeline are great.  i think it is a bit overpriced and i would like a MAC version

Review.Titre: OfficeTimeline Improves Alignment of Project Schedules and is easy to use
Review.Contenu: OfficeTimeline is easy to use and allowed us to keep our detailed project schedules and plans-on-page in sync.

Review.Titre: Easy to Make A Schedule for a Meeting
Review.Contenu: I am a scheduler for construction projects throughout the US and Office Timeline allows me to summarize my schedules so easily. Great presentation tool!

Review.Titre: Great visual tool with easy integration
Review.Contenu: The tool provides good visual, an easy intergration with Excel and Smartsheets. Integration with Powerpoint (firmatting) can be better though

Review.Titre: I like the software...
Review.Contenu: I like the software. I've been using it for three years. I think the desktop version should just have a version with all the tools for $150.

Review.Titre: Professional results
Review.Contenu: I like the look of the resulting timelines but would need to spend more time on how to tailor a template.

Review.Titre: Nice/fast way to design/plan process
Review.Contenu: Nice to design/plan processI wish a features not available: the possibility to format characters and to define position freerly

Review.Titre: Ease of use
Review.Contenu: The ease to put together a high level timeline, actions and progress for management to understand the status of the project.

Review.Titre: Good application
Review.Contenu: Good application. Makes what it's meant for.There is still room for improvment.

Review.Titre: Great!
Review.Contenu: Helps sketching of ideas & different scenarios, and presentations that speak to a broader audience. Anxious for the roll out task relationships capability, as this will accelerate the schedule building process

Review.Titre: Great
Review.Contenu: Great, only wish sometime I wish I could add more information in one timeline.

Review.Titre: Great tool for fast and easy project plans
Review.Contenu: This is a great tool to fast and easy create a real appealing project plan.

Review.Titre: easy and fast to use for beautifull…
Review.Contenu: easy and fast to use for beautifull presentation charts

Review.Titre: Fast, easy tool for creating timelines
Review.Contenu: Very nice tool for rapidly creating polished timelines in your PowerPoint presentations.

Review.Titre: Looks good and is effective
Review.Contenu: Looks pretty good, is effective and helps maintain consistency.

Review.Titre: Easy to use
Review.Contenu: Easy to use. Wonderful timelines that make impactful presentations.

Review.Titre: User friendly and presentable format
Review.Contenu: User FriendlyEasy to useClear and presentable formatEasy to edit from PPTCompatible to use in other PC

Review.Titre: Office Timeline integrates well with…
Review.Contenu: Office Timeline integrates well with PowerPoint and saves me significant time generating and maintaining Gantt chart slides.

Review.Titre: I really like the tool
Review.Contenu: I really like the tool, it is flexible and easy to implement

Review.Titre: Its a great product but still a few…
Review.Contenu: Its a great product but still a few bugs - can be fragile. Helping me with what I need.

Review.Titre: It would be great if the app built…
Review.Contenu: It would be great if the app built multiple slides from the data entered.

Review.Titre: Love the simplicity!
add a summary bar in your timeline…
Review.Contenu: add a summary bar in your timeline would be better

Review.Titre: I really like it

Review.Titre: A gem and a must-have for anyone who…

The only con I see is that you have to choose between PowerPoint add-in or online version for the Pro level. It would be nice to have both in one, to enable collaboration with others.

Review.Titre: This is a great tool for creating…
Review.Contenu: This is a great tool for creating timelines. There are some small updates that would be great like making the dates link. Ex:  Date Ends:  12/1 Next Mile stone would be 12/2.  A little more flexibility with editing the timeline on the top.  Along with editing the entire timeline if the items don't fit on the page.

Review.Titre: Great add to your presentations!!!
Review.Contenu: Tool is great! It need a lot of work to manipulate and grouping milestones to fit the space you would like to but at the end the effort is worth it.Still a little confuse when trying to work with a table and perform the changes at the table so it can be reflected at the presentation but I believe this is my fault (lack of time to learn more about the tool).
