Review.Titre: Office timeline experience
Review.Contenu: I like to work with office timeline and develop timeline overviews in a good presentation format easy to read. Overall I am satisfied with the tool.I am looking forward to the next releases with hopefully more flexible time band (self choice what shall be shown) and with the possibility to show relations.In addition I would like to have the "hide button" also for the Task title even I understood why it wasn't implemented.

Review.Titre: A simple and clear way to present a project plan
Review.Contenu: Office Timeline a much better and clear way to present a project plan. There are some bugs in the software e.g. always default back to the original timescale settings or date/time format after each update. I would have given it a 5 stars if those bugs are fixed. Nevertheless, it's still an excellent tool.

Review.Titre: Love this tool for visualization
Review.Contenu: Love this tool for visualization.  I use it for my program management.However, I was forced to move from Windows PC to Macbook Pro and I find the online tool a little cumbersome. Additionally, while I prefer Powerpoint, my company now uses the GSuite tools so the tool Google Slides is now my default.  If you can create a tool for Mac and GSuite, you'd have a huge growth opportunity

Review.Titre: Easy to use visualisation
Review.Contenu: Previously tried several different Gant visualisation methods to assist my teams in understanding end to end project timings. Office Timeline has received universal praise from my cross functional partners in it's clarity and for me, it takes minutes to pull together visuals for presentations, project meetings, specific workstreams.

Review.Titre: This is a great tool
Review.Contenu: This is a great tool, but users should be aware of how much they can fit onto the timeline. I had to go to a 50,000ft view vs. a 10,000 ft view because I could not get the timeline to expand to include more information. I would love it if we could have the timeline go over two slides so we could add more detail when needed. No matter what this is a great tool for visualizing work and schedule.

Review.Titre: Advantages & Area of Improvement
Review.Contenu: It makes work easy with simple timelines that can be presented to clients and management and can show the detailed information with more simpler language . maybe needs more conclusive data to be shown like the total percentage of  completed tasks and percentage of time completed up to 'today' referenced.There is % completion when you edit data, but it is not accurate and doesn't show the actual number for some reason.

Review.Titre: I think Office Timeline is a great…
Review.Contenu: I think Office Timeline is a great alternative to using an MPP. It provides clients the ability to understand the high level milestones within their project without the need to study an entire project plan. So, far this tool has been very useful in assisting me with explaining the task requirements of my clients.

Review.Titre: The charts look nice
Review.Contenu: The charts look great, but the labels/headings for each item should be able to format to smaller pages. Often if the tasking or label is too long, it overlaps the bars and makes it much harder to read.There should be an ability to generate actual timelines, the more traditional ones with main or important dates listed along one single line. Would also be interesting to create an option for a timeline or gantt chart that is less linear. Something that reflects the iterative nature of work.

Review.Titre: Comments:
Review.Contenu: Comments:- I would be interested to reduce the size of the Chart in order that it could fit a powerpoint slide. At the moment the slide is (too) fast filled, it exceed the slide.I don't know how to proceed.- To align milestone I do it from the "edit timeline". Is there a way to do it with the "style panel". I did not find it and I do not know if it is linked to the chart style I selected at the beginning.

Review.Titre: As a contract project manager I use…
Review.Contenu: As a contract project manager I use OfficeTimeline online version. Being in to cloud it can  follows me from client to client. Easy to use, seamlessly produces beautiful  PowerPoint presentations of my projects timeline that I can present to management. Something ms project desktop should do but does not. As a pm I do t have time to mess around in word or excel,  power point to produce a timeline diagram.  This app is awesome.

Review.Titre: Helping a lot with PMO update timeline
Review.Contenu: Helping a lot with PMO timeline scheduling and updates to the teams.

Review.Titre: Office Timeline is awesome.

In a swimlane, it would be really helpful to be able to be able to have milestones or events NEXT to each other, just like how you can up top with the little milestone flags. It would help me use the swimlane space more efficiently, instead of having each milestone be on its own "line"2. Enable dependencies so that if I move milestone A out 3 months, the downstream milestones also move out 3 months, and i dont have to go through manually and do this. Y'all rock!! Keep up the good work.

It comes with some terrific pre-formatted timelines, however, I noticed that the online version has different ones that I wish you could access without having to pay for another subscription. Review.Titre: Office Timeline Pro:  Simple & Effective

Review.Titre: Perfect Gantt Chart add-in for PowerPoint
Review.Contenu: I've been using Office Time for a couple years now and really enjoy how easy it is to use and incorporate into PowerPoint. Review.Titre: Great Product - Time saver
Review.Contenu: Such a time saver!!    No more painstaking updates in excel coloring boxes :)   I just need to remember to click the "Accept Changes" button before I edit dates again (if I make a formatting change on the timeline)Their customer service replied to my question promptly too.  They were very happy to tell me how to fix my issue.  (It was a feature already built in that I didn't know existed)   It's rare for a SW company to be so helpful - much appreciated!

Review.Titre: Leadership loves the visual!
Review.Contenu: I started using this to help Leadership understand high level timelines for our tech projects and they love it! I haven't yet explored all the ways to use it, but it was beneficial from day 1.

Review.Titre: Freedom for PMs
Review.Contenu: Office timeline gives me a lot of freedom as a PM. A lot of times in the beginning of a project you don't have the timeline nailed down or you want to see scenarios and high level over views of what the timeline looks like Office timeline has come in key for this. I love being able to import from project and giving clients and executives an easy to read 8 week look ahead of projects. I've only barely touched the surface of the product but thus far I have no complaints.

Review.Titre: Great augmentation to the regular Gantt…
Review.Contenu: Great augmentation to the regular Gantt charts that come with MS Project. As a recommendation, please retain any custom formatting on "Refresh Data" ie I may add a custom color with a drop shadow to a timeline bar, but when I refresh the data, that formatting reverts back to default Look forward to future features

Review.Titre: Game changer
Review.Contenu: Office Timeline is a game changer for me. We are planning a relocation to a new facility and doing timelines this way is about 1/3 of the time from doing excel versions. And much more flexible. And if you are a die hard Project person they work with that as well.

Review.Titre: Great tool for GANTT Chart
Review.Contenu: I have used several program management tools, but I prefer to use Office Timeline for GANTT charts. It's easy to create GANTT charts by just entering the dates and milestones. You can select from several display options. Most of the program management tools have GANTT charts, but they are not visually appealing. If have to present to my leadership (VP/CxO), I prefer Offline Timeline. The basic package is worth the $99 annual fee.

Review.Titre: Efficient Way to Create and Update Project Timelines
Review.Contenu: Efficient Way to Create and Update Project TimelinesThe biggest advantage of this add-on is its ability to connect timelines outlined from either MS Excel or MS Office and translate them into a visual timeline generated into MS PowerPoint. Therefore, any changes made into the MS Excel / MS Project timelines can be easily reflected into the visual PowerPoint timeline within the click of a button (the ‘Refresh Data’ button). This program has made it easy for me to present and communicate changing timelines quickly and efficiently. The program also allows a variety of visual customizations for timelines generated on PowerPoint. This program has been very beneficial for me as a project manager.

Review.Titre: product works very well

Review.Titre: Great Time-Savings!

Review.Titre: This is one of the best and easiest products!

You can drag milestones and tasks around in relation to one another and dates will autocalculate on the fly. I was able to scramble an entire portfolio of deployment dates and have a clean output in real time. It's getting a little pricey but still reasonable for a corporate user.

Review.Contenu: This is a great tool for automating creation of project roadmaps and other timetable visualizations. Overall, this has helped create consistency in the outputs within the team I am a part of, who all use this as well. This also makes our work more efficient as opposed to the tediousness of shifting, resizing, etc of chevrons or shapes if done manually.

Review.Titre: Very helpful tool, easy to use
Review.Contenu: To me, this is a must-have tool, very useful for PowerPoint presentations. When I need a timeline, a Gantt chart, or a roadmap to make the information easily digestible to everyone, this is the perfect tool to do any of them. The roadmaps and timelines are clear and crisp, looking stunning at the same time. I particularly like the swimlanes, that help group the information in a relevant way, and the drag-and-drop functionality that makes all the work really simple and intuitive. Also, data import and the copy-paste feature save me a lot of time when it comes to getting my data into the timeline. Not to mention the load of templates that come with the add-in. I particularly find templates helpful because sometimes I'm just not inspired on how I want my timeline to look, so I find a lot of ideas there. Plus, I don't have to work hard to build something from scratch. Many times, for me it's just 2-3 clicks to customize, wham-bam, ready to go! Thank you, Office Timeline!

Review.Titre: Elegant professional looking project…
Review.Contenu: Elegant professional looking project plans. Invest the short time needed to learn it to save hours and hours messing about with the native power point tools

Review.Titre: Great Experience
Review.Contenu: I have been using this for a few years and love it!  easy to use and makes my project timelines look fantastic.  I can put a lot of detail on a slide and have it be easily understood by my audience.

Review.Titre: Great - yet some items need improvement.
Review.Contenu: I have been using the software for about 30 days and I really like it.  It is giving me really sharp looking graphs/charts that I can use in PPT, or I have exported these images to use in my academic scientific papers as figures in Word docs.  The two challenges I have is 1) sometimes the file saving aspect does not work and without notice the file converts back to some earlier version.  I have followed the suggested ideas but this is just very challenging when working toward deadlines.  I SAVE my file and start a new one each day so I have the previous days work saved to convert back to.  I do this with Word files for my academic writing so I am used to that but for a software to corrupt itself like this - its a challenge.  2) For sizing we are stuck using PPT sizing formats; I know how to set this up for posters etc for academic research but resizing for different outputs using this software is also challenging.  Not everything I do with a schedule is for PPT presentation.  I tried to just do an 8.5 x 11 paper size and again it didn't like it and reverted my file back to some earlier version.  In fairness to Office Timeline they may have some workarounds for these that I have not fully explored but I am a power user of Office PPT and these things should just not happen IMO.  I am still giving it 5 stars in-spite of this feedback so that should tell you something as well.  I do recommend it, yet be prepared for some modest learning curves.  Good luck!
